title: usb c audio
content:
Using traditional heapdphones with the supplied USB C headphone jack is a complete FAIL!
I have had Pixel phones since inception and after the Pixel 2 listening to music, making/receiving calls using the supplied USB C headphone jack is practically impossible.
To (re)solve I have tried:
Resetting the phone: issues goes away and then eventually comes back
Logging multiple support tickets, nothing found, no HW issues found
Unistalling apps
Re-start in SAFE mode
Multiple USB options in DEVELOPER mode
Cleaning the USB port
...
...
...

I can go on....

Support suggested a RESET, obviously this is not the preferred option. I would argue though that a full reset should not be required.
There should be a bug/tracing mechanism on the phone/OS that kills or warns of a HW malfunction or a SW issue. 
The fact that this issue is on/off (i had it come and go in my Pixel2 XL and now 3XL) makes the quality and reliability of the phone very questionable. 
A shame, as all other functions are faultless in my experience. Bring back headphone jack and I think a lot of these issues would disappear.

What is being done to resolving this issue for the multiple users facing this problem?
